quest.name: Golems Begone
journal: Slowfix wants you to eliminate the golems that prowl Idyllshire.

Golem sentinels left by the Sharlayans are hampering Slowfix's plans for expanding Idyllshire, and the goblin asks that you eliminate them. As a native of Sharlayan, Y'shtola may know an easy way to deal with the creatures.

Y'shtola shares with you the coded command required to unmake the golems. With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to inform each golem that you want to play a game called “Noughts and Crosses.”
You have unmade all the golems in your assigned area. Return to Slowfix with the good tidings.
You report the completion of your task to Slowfix. The goblin is pleased to hear that the golems will no longer impede the expansion effort.
objectives: With the chat mode in Say, enter “Noughts and Crosses” to unmake golems.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... So uplanders agree to help? Good! Here is what Slowfix wants uplanders to do.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Many golems prowl Idyllshire, get in the way of expansion plans. Slowfix wants uplanders to eliminate golems.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Uplanders are Sharlayan, yes? Sharlayans should know best way to deal with creatures.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Slowfix wants uplanders to eliminate golems. Uplanders are Sharlayan, yes? Sharlayans should know best way to deal with creatures.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: From the goblins' perspective, such a well-appointed city is certainly an attractive proposition.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I suppose it's only to be expected that others would come and occupy Sharlayan. Nonetheless, it feels akin to having strangers take over your home in your absence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Sentinel golems? I daresay Y'shtola will know how to deal with them.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So we are to eliminate the golems. That should be a simple enough affair.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The automata were employed as sentinels, and by design can be unmade with a coded command. At the time of the exodus, it was “Noughts and Crosses,” and I see no reason why it should not still work.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us divide the task between the three of us, the quicker to be finished with it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter the coded command “Noughts and Crosses” to unmake a golem.

dialogue.name: SAYTODO
dialogue.text: Noughts and Crosses

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Use the coded command “Noughts and Crosses” to unmake the golems. If all goes well, we can accomplish the task without recourse to violence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I shall see to the golems beyond this point. The area yonder, I leave in your capable hands.

dialogue.name: GOLEM01656
dialogue.text: <rumble> <rumble>

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter the password “Noughts and Crosses” to unmake a golem.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With a shudder, the golem crumbles to pieces.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Golems are no more? Wonderful!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Now we can resume work to expand settlement!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to report that my golems obediently crumbled at my command.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Of all the luck, one of my golems was not receptive to the password, and tried to pummel me bloody. Thankfully, I managed to dance clear of its fists and strike it down.
